alert.note: Alert for Camden; Gloucester (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 09 at 5:53PM EDT until September 09 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN CAMDEN AND NORTH CENTRAL GLOUCESTER COUNTIES... At 553 PM EDT, an NWS employee reported thunderstorms with heavy rain producing flash flooding on I-295 in Bellmawr. Between 1 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1 inch in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...NWS employee. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Philadelphia, Camden, Gloucester City, Cherry Hill, Deptford, Lindenwold, Bellmawr, Woodbury, Magnolia, Westville, Woodbury Heights, and National Park. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 3. Interstate 76 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 22 and 35. Interstate 676 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 4. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
